(FIND OUT MORE: https://www.unt.edu/academics/index.html) (Apply Now: https://www.unt.edu/admissions/index.html) Enrollment Soars at UNT With more than 46,000 students, UNT is the top choice for career readiness in Texas 46,309 Total enrollment 3,278 Transfer students 3,112 UNT at Frisco enrollment Why UNT? 114 Bachelor's degrees to choose from. Our students excel as teachers, artists, engineers and everything in between. 126 Master's & Doctoral degrees and more than 90 online program options. Academics & Research Ranked a Tier One research university by the Carnegie Classification, one of 146 institutions in the U.S. recognized for very high research activity 95 academic programs ranked among the nation's Top 100 Named a top college for enrolling transfer students by U.S. News & World Report Affordability Annually awards more than $456 million in financial aid , including more than $70 million in scholarships top college for students graduating with the least debt Quality of Life Ranked 44th in the nation for social mobility Located in Denton, one of the best college towns in the nation Recognized as a Hispanic- and Minority-Serving Institution dedicated to reflecting the population of Texas Patridge Filter: Academics Alumni News Research - or - Randomize THIS IS WHERE YOU BELONG (: https://www.unt.edu) Apply Now Become an Eagle Apply now Become an Eagle  17 Years in a row named one of America’s Top Colleges by Forbes 7th Best College Town in the nation according to 247WallSt.com 95 Academic programs ranked among the nation’s Top 100 Thinking about UNT? It’s easy to apply online. Join us and discover why we’re the choice of more than 46,000 students. Body: (Skip to main content: https://www.unt.edu/parents-family.html#main) (INFO FOR: https://www.unt.edu/parents-family.html) (Back: https://www.unt.edu/parents-family.html) Parents and Family Welcome to the Mean Green family Great things happen when your family joins ours. Sign up for Parent and Family Orientation to learn how we can work together to support your student. (Sign Up Now: https://studentaffairs.unt.edu/orientation-and-transition-programs/programs/orientation/family-and-guests/) Guide for parents This guide is a great source of information about UNT, where you can learn more about everything from academics and support services to scholarships and security. (Download A Parent's Guide to UNT PDF in English & En Español.: https://www.unt.edu/_images/23_440_parents_guide_proof4.pdf) (: https://parentsguide.unt.edu/sites/default/files/22_373_Parents_Guide_FIN_CC_MoreAccessible.pdf) (Cost: https://www.unt.edu/parents-family.html#paying-for-college) (Academic information: https://www.unt.edu/parents-family.html#degrees-and-majors) (Support services: https://www.unt.edu/parents-family.html#support-services) (Health and Safety: https://www.unt.edu/parents-family.html#health-and-safety) (Parent resources: https://www.unt.edu/parents-family.html#parent-programs) (Admissions information: https://www.unt.edu/admissions/index.html) (Just getting started with your college search?Help your student learn how to choose the right college.: https://outreach.unt.edu/how-to-choose) (Visit Us: https://www.unt.edu/parents-family.html#visit-us) Paying for college Tuition costs are a big part of planning for college, and your student's education is one of the best investments you’ll ever make. College graduates, on average, earn 44% more than high school graduates, according to research done by the College Board. Simply put, a college degree pays off. (Tuition and fees: https://studentaccounting.unt.edu/tuition-and-fees) UNT provides the quality of a private university at an affordable cost. (UNT tuition estimator: https://estimatemytuition.unt.edu/) See for yourself how affordable a UNT degree can be for you. (Save and Soar Tuition plan: https://www.unt.edu/saveandsoar.html) Choose the Save and Soar tuition plan and lock in your tuition rate, while also enjoying exclusive savings on summer and winter sessions. (Online tuition payment options: https://my.unt.edu/) (Financial aid at UNT: https://financialaid.unt.edu/) Learn about financial aid, grants, loans and work-study programs. (Scholarships at UNT: https://financialaid.unt.edu/scholarships) UNT annually awards more than $60 million in scholarships. About 75 percent of UNT students receive financial aid and scholarships. (Student Accounting: https://studentaccounting.unt.edu/) Learn about tuition and fees, payment options, refunds and short-term loans (Student jobs at the Career Center: https://careercenter.unt.edu/) UNT employs more than 5,000 students through the Career Center’s Eagle Career Network, powered by Handshake. (Degree in three plans: https://vpaa.unt.edu/advising/students/degrees/dtpall) (Emerald Eagle Scholars Program: https://emeraldeagles.unt.edu/) Scholarship and academic success program for high achieving, high financial-need students. (Short-term and emergency loans from the UNT Student Money Management Center: https://moneymanagement.unt.edu/programs-and-services/eagle-support-program.html) Degrees and Majors UNT is the choice of nearly 47,000 students and is a student-centered public research university. As one of Texas' largest universities, UNT offers (114 bachelor’s degrees, 87 master’s degrees and 39 doctoral degrees: https://programs.unt.edu) , many nationally and internationally recognized. Academic Support UNT offers many resources to help students succeed in their college classes. (Succeed at UNT: https://www.unt.edu/success/) (The Learning Center: https://learningcenter.unt.edu/) (Math Lab: https://learningcenter.unt.edu/virtual-math-lab) (Writing Center: https://writingcenter.unt.edu/) (Honors College: https://honors.unt.edu/) Students of all majors can apply for the Honors College which prepares them for academic challenges and intellectual growth in a world of opportunity. Health and safety We work hard to create a safe environment at UNT. Our Eagle Alert System sends voice and text information about campus closings and emergency situations affecting the safety and well being of people on and around our campus. UNT police patrol the campus 24 hours a day. At night, the campus is well lit, and students may request pick up from e-ride, get a Lyft ride back to their residence halls or to their cars on campus from 2 – 7 a.m. or call the UNT police for an escort, if needed. UNT offers a full-service primary care clinic, with full-time physicians, nurse practitioners and nurses to manage your child's care and treatment. (Eagle Alert: https://www.unt.edu/eaglealert.html) (UNT Police Department: https://police.unt.edu/) (Campus safety, severe weather info and emergency preparedness: https://www.unt.edu/safety-emergency) (Security and Fire Safety Report & Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Policy and Campus Crime Statistics: https://clery.unt.edu/) (Office of Emergency Management: https://riskmanagement.unt.edu/emergency/emss_landing_page) (E-ride late night transportation service: https://transportation.unt.edu/campus-transit.html) (Student Health and Wellness Center: https://studentaffairs.unt.edu/student-health-and-wellness-center/) (Student Recreation Center: https://recsports.unt.edu/) (Counseling and Testing: https://studentaffairs.unt.edu/counseling-and-testing-services/index.html) Denton Police Department Denton Regional Medical Center Presbyterian Hospital of Denton (COVID-19 Health and Safety: https://studentaffairs.unt.edu/student-health-and-wellness-center/services/covid) Support Services From where to live and eat, to what to do on campus and everything in between, we’ve got what your student needs to thrive at UNT academically and socially. Welcome to UNT: (Orientation and Transition Programs: https://studentaffairs.unt.edu/orientation-and-transition-programs/) (Housing: https://housing.unt.edu/) (Campus Dining: https://dining.unt.edu/) (Transportation: https://transportation.unt.edu/) Get Involved: (Center for Leadership and Service: https://studentaffairs.unt.edu/center-for-leadership-and-service) (Student Activities Center: https://studentaffairs.unt.edu/student-activities-center) (Student Organizations: https://studentaffairs.unt.edu/student-activities-center/programs-and-services/student-organizations) (Events on Campus: https://calendar.unt.edu/) (Center for Belonging and Engagement: https://studentaffairs.unt.edu/center-for-belonging-and-engagement/index.html) (UNT International Programs and events: https://international.unt.edu) (Talons: https://studentaffairs.unt.edu/student-activities-center/programs-and-services/spirit/talons/index.html) Here to Help: (Dean of Students: https://studentaffairs.unt.edu/dean-of-students/) (Student Legal Services: https://studentaffairs.unt.edu/dean-of-students/programs-and-services/student-legal-services/)  Font Awesome fontawesome.com (Office of Disability Access: https://studentaffairs.unt.edu/office-disability-access/) (Office of Equal Opportunity: https://titleixeo.unt.edu/index.html) Parent programs and the Parent Association UNT has an office solely devoted to parent programs, offering many ways for parents to get involved in their student's experience. The UNT Parent Association allows you to play an active role in your student's accomplishments while building friendships with other parents. (Office of Parent Programs at UNT: https://studentaffairs.unt.edu/orientation-and-transition-programs/programs/parent-programs/) (Parent Association: https://studentaffairs.unt.edu/orientation-and-transition-programs/programs/parent-association/) (Information about Parental Access to Student Records: https://registrar.unt.edu/parents) (Parent Association scholarship information: https://studentaffairs.unt.edu/orientation-and-transition-programs/programs/parent-association/scholarships) UNT Mean Green Family Facebook group Events for parents and family To help ensure that your child makes a successful transition to college, attend parent orientation, which is held concurrently with each freshman orientation session and transfer orientation session. We also encourage parents, grandparents, siblings and friends to join us for Family Weekend , which is held each fall. Events include a football game, chili cook-off and activities for siblings. (Parent Orientation: https://studentaffairs.unt.edu/orientation-and-transition-programs/programs/orientation/family-and-guests/) Attend orientation sessions specifically for parents. (Family Weekend: https://studentaffairs.unt.edu/orientation-and-transition-programs/programs/family-weekend/) (UNT events and academic calendar: https://calendar.unt.edu/) (Mean Green Move-In: https://housing.unt.edu/housing_how-to/mean_green_move_in) (UNT Preview: https://www.unt.edu/admissions/events/unt-preview.html) Get a sneak peek at campus life and your future at UNT. (Admitted Students Day: https://www.unt.edu/admissions/events/admitday.html) A chance for admitted students to get an insider's view of college life on campus and in Denton. UNT Bookstore spirit gear (UNT traditions: https://www.unt.edu/legacy/) Visit Us We encourage you to visit the campus and take a guided tour . You'll find out what UNT offers, become familiar with the campus and have a chance to ask our student tour guides questions. (Schedule a campus tour: http://tours.unt.edu/) (Campus map: https://map.unt.edu) (UNT parking information: https://transportation.unt.edu/parking-on-campus.html) Local area restaurants Local area hotels Discover Denton Things to do in the D/FW area
It’s easy to apply online. Join us and discover why we’re the choice of nearly 47,000 students. (Get More Info: https://www.unt.edu/admissions/requestinfo.html)

(Download A Parent's Guide to UNT PDF in English & En Español.: https://www.unt.edu/_images/23_440_parents_guide_proof4.pdf) (: https://parentsguide.unt.edu/sites/default/files/22_373_Parents_Guide_FIN_CC_MoreAccessible.pdf) (Cost: https://www.unt.edu/parents-family.html#paying-for-college) (Academic information: https://www.unt.edu/parents-family.html#degrees-and-majors) (Support services: https://www.unt.edu/parents-family.html#support-services) (Health and Safety: https://www.unt.edu/parents-family.html#health-and-safety) (Parent resources: https://www.unt.edu/parents-family.html#parent-programs) (Admissions information: https://www.unt.edu/admissions/index.html) (Just getting started with your college search?Help your student learn how to choose the right college.: https://outreach.unt.edu/how-to-choose) (Visit Us: https://www.unt.edu/parents-family.html#visit-us) Paying for college Tuition costs are a big part of planning for college, and your student's education is one of the best investments you’ll ever make. College graduates, on average, earn 44% more than high school graduates, according to research done by the College Board. Simply put, a college degree pays off. (Tuition and fees: https://studentaccounting.unt.edu/tuition-and-fees) UNT provides the quality of a private university at an affordable cost. (UNT tuition estimator: https://estimatemytuition.unt.edu/) See for yourself how affordable a UNT degree can be for you. (Save and Soar Tuition plan: https://www.unt.edu/saveandsoar.html) Choose the Save and Soar tuition plan and lock in your tuition rate, while also enjoying exclusive savings on summer and winter sessions. (Online tuition payment options: https://my.unt.edu/) (Financial aid at UNT: https://financialaid.unt.edu/) Learn about financial aid, grants, loans and work-study programs. (Scholarships at UNT: https://financialaid.unt.edu/scholarships) UNT annually awards more than $60 million in scholarships. About 75 percent of UNT students receive financial aid and scholarships. (Student Accounting: https://studentaccounting.unt.edu/) Learn about tuition and fees, payment options, refunds and short-term loans (Student jobs at the Career Center: https://careercenter.unt.edu/) UNT employs more than 5,000 students through the Career Center’s Eagle Career Network, powered by Handshake. (Degree in three plans: https://vpaa.unt.edu/advising/students/degrees/dtpall) (Emerald Eagle Scholars Program: https://emeraldeagles.unt.edu/) Scholarship and academic success program for high achieving, high financial-need students. (Short-term and emergency loans from the UNT Student Money Management Center: https://moneymanagement.unt.edu/programs-and-services/eagle-support-program.html) Degrees and Majors UNT is the choice of nearly 47,000 students and is a student-centered public research university. As one of Texas' largest universities, UNT offers (114 bachelor’s degrees, 87 master’s degrees and 39 doctoral degrees: https://programs.unt.edu) , many nationally and internationally recognized. Academic Support UNT offers many resources to help students succeed in their college classes. (Succeed at UNT: https://www.unt.edu/success/) (The Learning Center: https://learningcenter.unt.edu/) (Math Lab: https://learningcenter.unt.edu/virtual-math-lab) (Writing Center: https://writingcenter.unt.edu/) (Honors College: https://honors.unt.edu/) Students of all majors can apply for the Honors College which prepares them for academic challenges and intellectual growth in a world of opportunity. Health and safety We work hard to create a safe environment at UNT. Our Eagle Alert System sends voice and text information about campus closings and emergency situations affecting the safety and well being of people on and around our campus. UNT police patrol the campus 24 hours a day. At night, the campus is well lit, and students may request pick up from e-ride, get a Lyft ride back to their residence halls or to their cars on campus from 2 – 7 a.m. or call the UNT police for an escort, if needed. UNT offers a full-service primary care clinic, with full-time physicians, nurse practitioners and nurses to manage your child's care and treatment. The UNT Parent Association allows you to play an active role in your student's accomplishments while building friendships with other parents. We also encourage parents, grandparents, siblings and friends to join us for Family Weekend , which is held each fall. Events include a football game, chili cook-off and activities for siblings.
